title: Google Touts Real-Time Camera AI

author: Kehl Bayern

text: It looks like Google is bringing its advanced AI to Gemini phones, at least if you’re signed up for the Google One AI Premium plan. A close up of a cell phone with an AI button. Photo by Solen Feyissa And not only that, but this AI can view the world as you see it in real time through your phone. That means it can look at screens, your surroundings, or wherever you point your lens. It’s definitely a huge next step for consumer smartphones, and a somewhat gigantic leap in general. After all, this opens the door to putting AI in everything and we’re pretty certain nothing will be the same. First spotted on Reddit on a user’s Xiaomi device, this follows Google’s promises to integrate AI into its devices, The Verge reports, citing project Astra. An example cited by the website and used in a YouTube video is asking the AI to help with a matching paint color but the real-world use cases are well beyond just that. Citing Apple’s Siri, The Verge notes this could be the first in a broader move to not only put AI into everything but also replace the somewhat lacking voice assistants we currently have with something a little more functional (we’re looking at you Siri). We’ve also covered stories about AI being integrated directly into more traditional cameras as well. What impact this will have on the art remains to be seen but it could be interesting from a technical standpoint. Whether photographers will want more or less control over certain things will also probably be an issue front and center with AI. Of course, we’ll keep you updated as things progress. Any thoughts that you might have on AI and camera integration are welcome in the comments below. Check out some of our other photography news at this link. Kehl is our staff photography news writer since 2017 and has over a decade of experience in online media and publishing and you can get to know him better here and follow him on Insta.
html:
It looks like Google is bringing its advanced AI to Gemini phones, at least if you’re signed up for the Google One AI Premium plan.

And not only that, but this AI can view the world as you see it in real time through your phone.

That means it can look at screens, your surroundings, or wherever you point your lens.

It’s definitely a huge next step for consumer smartphones, and a somewhat gigantic leap in general. After all, this opens the door to putting AI in everything and we’re pretty certain nothing will be the same.

First spotted on Reddit on a user’s Xiaomi device, this follows Google’s promises to integrate AI into its devices, The Verge reports, citing project Astra.

An example cited by the website and used in a YouTube video is asking the AI to help with a matching paint color but the real-world use cases are well beyond just that.

Citing Apple’s Siri, The Verge notes this could be the first in a broader move to not only put AI into everything but also replace the somewhat lacking voice assistants we currently have with something a little more functional (we’re looking at you Siri).

We’ve also covered stories about AI being integrated directly into more traditional cameras as well. What impact this will have on the art remains to be seen but it could be interesting from a technical standpoint. Whether photographers will want more or less control over certain things will also probably be an issue front and center with AI. Of course, we’ll keep you updated as things progress.

Any thoughts that you might have on AI and camera integration are welcome in the comments below.

Check out some of our other photography news at this link.

Kehl is our staff photography news writer since 2017 and has over a decade of experience in online media and publishing and you can get to know him better here and follow him on Insta.
